intro: Mesembryanthemum albicaule, commonly known as the white-stemmed ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its stems allows it to survive in arid environments.
